content.question:
<math alttext="I 2, aqueous, plus, C 6 H 8 O 6, aqueous, react to produce, C 6 H 6 O 6, aqueous, plus, 2 I with a negative one charge, aqueous, plus, 2 H with a positive one charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
The compound <math alttext="C 6 H 8 O 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> reacts with <math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> according to the reaction represented by the equation above. The reaction is correctly classified as which of the following types?

choices.label: Acid-base, because <math alttext="H with a positive one charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> ions are produced.
Precipitation, because there are only two reactants but there are three products.

Double replacement, because both <math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> appear as ions in the products.

Oxidation-reduction, because <math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> is reduced.

content.answer: Oxidation-reduction, because <math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> is reduced.

skill.text: 1.B: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate both particulate-level and macroscopic- level properties.
